intro: Faramea polytriadophora, commonly known as the three-lobed faramea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and trifoliate leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
